iaik.pkcs.pkcs1

Class Padding

  • java.lang.Object
    • iaik.pkcs.pkcs1.Padding
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    PKCS1v15Padding

    public abstract class Padding
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract super class for all PKCS#1 based padding schemes.

    After initializing the Padding engine, call method pad or unpad for performing a padding or unpadding operation, respectively: 

     padding.init(Padding.PAD_MODE, key, modLen, params, random);
 byte[] paddedMessage = padding.pad(message);
    respectively 
     padding.init(Padding.UNPAD_MODE, key, modLen, params, random);
 byte[] message = padding.unpad(paddingMessage);
    Version:
    File Revision 9
    See Also:
    PKCS1v15Padding, OAEPPadding

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init(int paddingMode,
        java.security.Key key,
        int modLen,
        java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec params,
        java.security.SecureRandom random)
          throws java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                 java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        Initializes this Padding engine.
        Parameters:
        paddingMode - the padding mode, either PAD_MODE (1) or UNPAD_MODE (2)
        key - the en/decryption key; maybe used for checking conformance to the padding scheme
        modLen - the length of the key modulus
        params - parameters any parameters required by the padding scheme
        random - generator supplying random numbers if required
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the key is not appropriate for the padding scheme
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException - if the parameters are invalid, or the padding mode is invalid (not PAD_MODE (1) or UNPAD_MODE (2)

      • getParameters

        public abstract java.security.AlgorithmParameters getParameters()

      • pad

        public abstract byte[] pad(byte[] data)
                    throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Pads the supplied data.
        Parameters:
        data - the data to be padded
        Returns:
        the padded data
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if an error occurs during padding the data

      • unpad

        public abstract byte[] unpad(byte[] paddedData)
                      throws javax.crypto.BadPaddingException
        Unpads the supplied padded data.
        Parameters:
        paddedData - the data to be unpadded
        Returns:
        the unpadded data
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.BadPaddingException - if the padding was invalid
